intro: Comastoma pedunculatum, commonly known as the slender-stemmed mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers that are clustered in racemes at the ends of its stems. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and arctic environments. Comastoma pedunculatum is adapted to cold climates and is typically found in regions with harsh, seasonal weather conditions.
